Pericard scored his first goal for Swindon in the Johnstone Paint Trophy match against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 31 August 2010, hitting a 30th minute volley into the back of the net, followed by his second goal in injury time to make it 3â0.<ref>{{cite web|title= Southampton 0 - 3 Swindon|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8951114.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 September 2010|date=31 August 2010}}</ref>
Pericard scored his first goal for Swindon in the Johnstone Paint Trophy match against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 31 August 2010, hitting a 30th minute volley into the back of the net, followed by his second goal in injury time to make it 3â0.<ref>{{cite web|title= Southampton 0 - 3 Swindon|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8951114.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 September 2010|date=31 August 2010}}</ref>
â
At the start of the 2011 January transfer window Pericard is widely regarded as a failiure by town fans. His scoring record is very poor (making him statistically one of the worst Centre Forwards in Swindons recent history) and he is frequently booed when being introduced from the bench. This is where he earned the nickname 'Pericrap'. Despite this, he was voted Swindon's Player of the Year for the 2010/11 Season due to his immense popularity within the squad and his contributions to local charities.
+
At the start of the 2011 January transfer window Pericard is widely regarded as a failiure by town fans. His scoring record is very poor (making him statistically one of the worst Centre Forwards in Swindons recent history) and he is frequently booed when being introduced from the bench. Despite this, he was voted Swindon's Player of the Year for the 2010/11 Season due to his immense popularity within the squad and his contributions to local charities.
